revised_title: Royal Society's Activities and Scientific Achievements in 1892
tldr: The report covers various scientific researches and achievements of the Royal Society in 1892, including advancements in astronomy, astrophysics, photometry, and gland physiology. Notable achievements include progress in understanding gravitational effects in the Pleiades star cluster, the development of accurate photometric scales, and research on the physiological effects of nerves on secreting cells. The report also discusses the Society's efforts to improve the Catalogue of Scientific Papers and the work of various committees, such as the Water Research Committee and the Committee on Colour Vision.
